sentences.english: Cutting tuition and other expenses proves to be most beneficial to students.
sentences.chinese: 降低学费和杂费被证明是对学生最有利的。

sentences.english: This includes non-operating and incidental expenses.
Six, three procedures for inspection, after the hall to the basin to pay port charges.
sentences.chinese: 三检手续办理后，去港池大厅交港杂费。

sentences.english: Please lump all these items together under the heading “incidental expenses”.
sentences.chinese: 把这些费用归并列入“杂费”项内。

sentences.english: The basic educational expenditure such as tuition and incidentals in higher education increases quickly.
sentences.chinese: 高等教育中的学杂费等基本教育支出增长很快。

sentences.english: Those who complete the application for suspension before each semester will be exempted from the tuition fee.
sentences.chinese: 学期开始上课前办妥休学者，免缴学杂费。

sentences.english: They have refused to pay utility bills, prompting the authorities to turn off their hot water.
sentences.chinese: 他们开始拒付各种杂费，使得当局对他们停供了热水。

sentences.english: What about the tuition and fees of studying in America?
sentences.chinese: 在美国学习的学杂费是多少？

sentences.english: What is the total cost including hospital fees and other extras?
sentences.chinese: 包括住院费和其他杂费药费一共需要多少钱？

sentences.english: I won't bury myself under incidentals.
sentences.chinese: 我不会下埋葬自己杂费。

sentences.english: This is real money that students and families can use to pay for tuition and fees.
sentences.chinese: 这可是学生和他的家庭用来支付学杂费的真金白银。

sentences.english: The schools shall adjust tuition fees.
sentences.chinese: 各校调整学杂费之核算指标。

sentences.english: Registering with the Hotel and all room and incidental expenses will be paid upon check-out.
sentences.chinese: 所有的房费和杂费会在我退房时付清。

sentences.english: The non cost of revenues expenses are sometimes referred to as "overhead".
sentences.chinese: 非成本费用有时候指的是“杂费”。

sentences.english: In 2007, China exempted all the tuitions and surcharges on the rural free education.
sentences.chinese: 到2007年，中国免除了所有农村义务教育学杂费。

definition: rent for a room or house
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
to reduce or waive (taxes, punishment, rent, tuition etc)
